text.text_translated: In the last two centuries, technology and health improved. This meant fewer children died young. This caused the world's population to grow quickly. These large families produced even more children. These children survived into adulthood and had their own children. But in the 1960s, it became easier to get `contraception` (a way to stop women from getting pregnant). Because of this, the average number of babies per woman in the world has gone down. It went from six babies to as low as two.
